The 9th International Conference on
Artificial Intelligence and Statistics

[edit]

January 3 - 6, 2003
Key West, Florida, USA

The 9th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Statistics (Artificial Intelligence and Statistics 2003) will be held in Key West, Florida, USA from Friday, 3 January 2003 to Monday, 6 January 2003 at the The Hyatt Hotel.

Since its inception in 1985, AISTATS has been an interdisciplinary gathering of researchers at the intersection of artificial intelligence, machine learning, statistics, and related areas.

The Proceedings of Artificial Intelligence and Statistics 2003 are now available.

We are very pleased to report a record number of submissions to the conference. After a rigorous review process we have been able to accept 15% of the submissions for oral presentation and 27% for poster presentation.

Please take a look at the programme for the conference and the list of poster presentations.

Invited Speakers

  • Andrew Blake (Microsoft Research, Cambridge)
  • Bill Freeman (MIT)
  • Zoubin Ghahramani (Gatsby Centre)
  • David Haussler (UCSC)
  • Geoffrey Hinton (University of Toronto)
  • Tommi Jaakkola (MIT)
  • Lawrence Saul (University of Pennsylvania)

Key West provides a superb location for this workshop, and the weather at Key West in January is expected to be very pleasant. The workshop timetable will focus on morning and early evening sessions, allowing ample free time in the afternoons for scientific discussion or to take advantage of local attractions such as scuba diving,snorkelling, wave runners, parasailing, fishing, sailing and golf.

Conference Organisers

  • Christopher M. Bishop - Microsoft Research cmbishop@microsoft.com
  • Brendan Frey - University of Toronto frey@psi.toronto.edu
